alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Kingfisher; Logan; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washita, Kingfisher, northwestern Caddo, Custer, Blaine, northwestern Logan, eastern Dewey, southwestern Garfield, southeastern Major and northwestern Canadian Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 146 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Ames to 3 miles southeast of Eagle City to near Butler. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Kingfisher, Fairview, Hinton, Hennessey, Crescent, Waukomis, Geary, Okarche, Okeene, Thomas, Hydro, Arapaho, Canton, Calumet, Corn, Ringwood, and Dover. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 53 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Kingfisher; Logan; Washita
